home.title: HealthCheck - Health and Fitness Calculators
home.description: Free health and fitness calculators for body fat, BMI, TDEE, and more
home.content: HealthCheck provides free health and fitness calculators to help you track and improve your health. Our calculators include BMI, body fat percentage, TDEE, calorie deficit, and more.

bmi.title: BMI Calculator
bmi.description: Calculate your Body Mass Index (BMI) to assess your weight relative to your height
bmi.content: The Body Mass Index (BMI) calculator helps you assess your weight relative to your height. BMI is a widely used measure to identify possible weight problems in adults. It calculates your weight in kilograms divided by the square of your height in meters. While BMI doesn't directly measure body fat, it provides a reasonable estimate of body fat for most people and is used to categorize individuals as underweight, normal weight, overweight, or obese.

body-fat.title: Body Fat Calculator
body-fat.description: Calculate your body fat percentage using various methods including Navy method and skinfold measurements
body-fat.content: The Body Fat Calculator helps you estimate your body fat percentage using various methods including the Navy method, which uses waist, neck, and hip measurements. Body fat percentage is a better indicator of health than BMI as it distinguishes between fat mass and lean mass. Knowing your body fat percentage can help you set realistic fitness goals and track your progress over time.

body-fat-burn.title: Body Fat Burn Calculator
body-fat-burn.description: Calculate calories burned during physical activities and estimate how long it will take to reach your weight loss goals
body-fat-burn.content: The Body Fat Burn Calculator helps you estimate how many calories you burn during various physical activities and how long it will take to reach your weight loss goals through exercise. By inputting your gender, age, height, weight, activity type, duration, and frequency, you can get a personalized estimate of your calorie expenditure and fat loss timeline.

tdee.title: TDEE Calculator
tdee.description: Calculate your Total Daily Energy Expenditure to determine how many calories you burn each day
tdee.content: The TDEE (Total Daily Energy Expenditure) Calculator helps you determine how many calories you burn each day based on your age, gender, height, weight, and activity level. TDEE includes your Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) plus additional calories burned through physical activity and digestion. Knowing your TDEE is essential for weight management, as it represents your maintenance calories.

calorie-deficit.title: Calorie Deficit Calculator
calorie-deficit.description: Calculate your optimal calorie deficit for weight loss and estimate how long it will take to reach your goal
calorie-deficit.content: The Calorie Deficit Calculator helps you determine the optimal calorie deficit for weight loss based on your current weight, goal weight, and timeline. A calorie deficit occurs when you consume fewer calories than your body burns, leading to weight loss. This calculator helps you create a sustainable plan that balances effective weight loss with proper nutrition.

weight-management.title: Weight Management Calculator
weight-management.description: Plan your weight loss or gain journey with a target date and get a personalized calorie plan
weight-management.content: The Weight Management Calculator helps you plan your weight loss or gain journey with a target date. By entering your current weight, goal weight, and target date, you'll get a personalized calorie plan that tells you exactly how many calories to consume each day to reach your goal. The calculator ensures your plan is realistic and healthy.

maximum-fat-loss.title: Maximum Fat Loss Calculator
maximum-fat-loss.description: Calculate the maximum rate of fat loss possible based on your current body fat percentage
maximum-fat-loss.content: The Maximum Fat Loss Calculator helps you determine the maximum rate of fat loss that is physiologically possible based on your current body fat percentage and weight. This calculator uses research-based formulas to ensure your weight loss goals are realistic and sustainable, preventing muscle loss and metabolic adaptation.

absi.title: ABSI Calculator
absi.description: Calculate your A Body Shape Index (ABSI) to assess health risk based on waist circumference relative to BMI
absi.content: The ABSI (A Body Shape Index) Calculator helps you assess your health risk based on your waist circumference relative to your BMI and height. ABSI is a newer metric that may better predict mortality risk than BMI alone, particularly for individuals with central obesity. A higher ABSI indicates a more concentrated weight around the waist and potentially higher health risks.

whr.title: Waist-to-Hip Ratio Calculator
whr.description: Calculate your Waist-to-Hip Ratio (WHR) to assess your body fat distribution and health risk
whr.content: The Waist-to-Hip Ratio (WHR) Calculator helps you assess your body fat distribution and associated health risks. WHR is calculated by dividing your waist circumference by your hip circumference. A higher ratio indicates more fat stored around the waist ('apple shape'), which is associated with a higher risk of heart disease and type 2 diabetes compared to fat stored around the hips ('pear shape').

conversions.title: Health and Fitness Conversions
conversions.description: Convert between different units of measurement for weight, height, and more
conversions.content: The Health and Fitness Conversions calculator helps you convert between different units of measurement commonly used in health and fitness contexts. Convert between metric and imperial units for weight (kg/lb), height (cm/ft/in), and more. This tool is useful for international users and for understanding measurements in different systems.

blog.title: Health and Fitness Blog
blog.description: Articles and guides on health, fitness, nutrition, and weight management
blog.content: The HealthCheck blog provides evidence-based articles and guides on health, fitness, nutrition, and weight management. Our content is written by health professionals and fitness experts to help you make informed decisions about your health and fitness journey.

blog-tdee-explained.title: TDEE Explained: How Many Calories Do You Really Need?
blog-tdee-explained.description: Understand the components of Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE), how it's calculated, and why knowing your TDEE is crucial for effective weight management.
blog-tdee-explained.content: Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) represents the total number of calories your body burns in a day. It consists of your Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR), the energy used during physical activity, and the thermic effect of food. Understanding your TDEE is crucial for effective weight management as it helps you determine how many calories you need to maintain, lose, or gain weight. This article explains the components of TDEE, how it's calculated, factors that affect it, and how to use this knowledge for your health and fitness goals.

blog-calorie-deficit-myths.title: 5 Myths About Calorie Deficits Debunked
blog-calorie-deficit-myths.description: Discover the truth behind common misconceptions about calorie deficits, weight loss, and metabolism. Learn why weight loss isn't always linear and how to set realistic expectations.
blog-calorie-deficit-myths.content: Calorie deficits are essential for weight loss, but there are many myths and misconceptions surrounding them. This article debunks five common myths about calorie deficits: that extreme deficits lead to faster results, that metabolism permanently slows down during weight loss, that starvation mode will prevent weight loss, that weight loss should be linear, and that all calories are equal. Understanding the truth behind these myths can help you create a more effective and sustainable weight loss plan.

blog-measuring-body-fat.title: The Pros and Cons of Different Body Fat Measurement Methods
blog-measuring-body-fat.description: Compare the accuracy, accessibility, and practicality of various body fat assessment techniques, from DEXA scans to skinfold calipers to Navy method measurements.
blog-measuring-body-fat.content: Measuring body fat percentage can be done through various methods, each with its own advantages and limitations. This article compares different body fat measurement techniques including DEXA scans, hydrostatic weighing, air displacement plethysmography (Bod Pod), bioelectrical impedance analysis, skinfold calipers, and the Navy method. It discusses the accuracy, accessibility, cost, and practicality of each method to help you choose the most appropriate approach for your needs.

blog-understanding-absi.title: Understanding ABSI: A Better Measure of Body Shape
blog-understanding-absi.description: Learn about A Body Shape Index (ABSI) and why it might be a better predictor of health risks than BMI, especially for assessing central obesity.
blog-understanding-absi.content: A Body Shape Index (ABSI) is a relatively new metric that aims to improve upon the limitations of BMI by incorporating waist circumference relative to height and weight. This article explains what ABSI is, how it's calculated, and why it may be a better predictor of mortality risk than BMI alone, particularly for individuals with central obesity. It also discusses how to interpret your ABSI score and how to use this information to assess and improve your health.

blog-understanding-body-fat-percentage.title: Understanding Body Fat Percentage: What the Numbers Really Mean
blog-understanding-body-fat-percentage.description: Learn how to interpret body fat percentage measurements and what they mean for your health and fitness goals.
blog-understanding-body-fat-percentage.content: Body fat percentage is a key indicator of health and fitness that measures the proportion of fat mass to total body mass. This article explains what body fat percentage means, healthy ranges for men and women, the difference between essential fat and storage fat, and how body fat percentage relates to health and fitness goals. It also discusses how to interpret your body fat percentage results and set realistic goals based on your current level.

blog-waist-to-hip-ratio-guide.title: Waist-to-Hip Ratio Guide: What It Means for Your Health
blog-waist-to-hip-ratio-guide.description: Understand waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) and its significance for assessing health risks related to body fat distribution.
blog-waist-to-hip-ratio-guide.content: Waist-to-Hip Ratio (WHR) is a simple measurement that can provide valuable insights into your health risks based on how your body fat is distributed. This article explains what WHR is, how to measure it accurately, healthy ranges for men and women, and the health implications of different body shapes ('apple' versus 'pear'). It also discusses strategies for reducing WHR and improving overall health through diet, exercise, and lifestyle changes.

about.title: About HealthCheck
about.description: Learn about our mission to provide accurate, evidence-based health and fitness calculators and information
about.content: HealthCheck is dedicated to providing accurate, evidence-based health and fitness calculators and information to help you make informed decisions about your health. Our team of health professionals and fitness experts develops and reviews all content to ensure it meets the highest standards of accuracy and reliability.

contact.title: Contact HealthCheck
contact.description: Get in touch with the HealthCheck team for questions, feedback, or collaboration opportunities
contact.content: Have questions, feedback, or collaboration opportunities? Get in touch with the HealthCheck team through our contact form. We value your input and are committed to continuously improving our calculators and content based on user feedback.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: HealthCheck's privacy policy explaining how we collect, use, and protect your data
privacy.content: HealthCheck's privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your data. We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. This policy outlines our practices regarding data collection, usage, and your rights concerning your information.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.description: HealthCheck's terms of service outlining the rules and guidelines for using our website and calculators
terms.content: HealthCheck's terms of service outline the rules and guidelines for using our website and calculators. By using our services, you agree to these terms, which include information about acceptable use, intellectual property, disclaimers, and limitations of liability.

disclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer
disclaimer.description: Important information about the limitations of HealthCheck's calculators and content
disclaimer.content: HealthCheck's medical disclaimer provides important information about the limitations of our calculators and content. Our tools and information are for educational purposes only and are not intended to replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always consult with a qualified healthcare provider before making any health-related decisions.
